text:
I'm afraid there are no tourists currently that I'm aware of <@UFCK510Q6>.

But what i mean is many of us have taken things like our preferred grid from other frameworks and we include it in our base styles file and override the HubSpot grid when necessary to do what we want.
As i said there are no tutorials that I'm aware of for this, but it is doable
I am creating a HTML page template and using custom CSS. is there a way to disable the default styles that are outputted with {{ standard_header_includes }}
I see you can disable them when you create a page but was wondering if that could be done template side

for now I was able to solve this with jQuery to remove the stylesheet. // Remove HubSpot Default stylesheets from template
$('link[href*="HubSpot_Default.css"]').remove();
